Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 29th overall pick, by Oakland in 1970...
Traded from Oakland to Chicago (A) on 2/13/1970 (Going to OAK: P D. Demola. Going to CHW: 2B F. White)...
Had first career hit on 9/5/1973, off Dick Hughes (BAL)...
Hit first career homerun on 9/5/1973, off Dick Hughes (BAL)...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1976...
Injured on 6/3/1977 with a Sore Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Hit for the cycle against Oakland on 8/6/1977...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Oakland on 8/6/1977...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1977...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Baltimore on 5/22/1978...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1978...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (A) on 8/8/1979...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1979...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1980...
Signed as a free agent by Boston on 2/3/1982 to a 4-year deal worth $7,500,000 per year...
Was selected to the 1982 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/14/1982, hitting .379 with 2 HR, 6 RBI...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1982...
Drove in 6 runs against Chicago (A) on 5/19/1984...
Was selected to the 1984 Allstar game...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1984...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
